title: font for a military project
content:
Hi Everyone,  
I was wondering if you could help me with a typeface for a project. I did a logo for a project and was all set to go with it and then the name changed. I attached the previous logo.  
The new name needs to have capital and lowercase letters. I was wondering if anyone could suggest a good font for this. I like Foundry Gidnnik in medium or bold but I am lookig for something a bit more tough and militaryesque. The audience is the military and the feel for the project is "security and stealth" hence the first project name.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [stealth\_logo.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041510/http:/typophile.com/files/stealth_logo.png) | 1.63 KB |
author: erin4

comments.content:
Microgramma/Eurostile has the same basic shape (in bold extended), but includes a lowercase (no stencil cutouts, however)

[http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/bold-extended-2-63893/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041510/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/bold-extended-2-63893/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/eurostile/bold-extended-2-63893/")

To me, "tough" and "stealth" seem mutually exclusive... I could see "stealth in a VERY light weight sans serif, but "tough" usually tends toward somwthing like Goudy Oldstyle extrabold; you might compromise on something like Glaser Stencil ( [http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/glaser-stencil/](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041510/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/glaser-stencil/ "http://www.myfonts.com/fonts/ef/glaser-stencil/")), there's a "rough" version here too.
Doesn't this just scream for [United](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041510/http:/www.houseind.com/index.php?page=showfont&id=531)? Especially the stencil versions?
You can also try Kelly Twenty or DF Battery Park. Both from Veer.com
Thanks, I really like eurostile, I am messing around with that. If anyone has anymore suggestions that would be great. I do like United but the lowercase is important.
I usually like United in all uppercase, I feel like the lowercase is to angular for the new title which is 'Gateway'

I have been starting to really like using Blair or Bank Gothic, i am now tring to find a font that cooridantes well with them with nice lowercase set. (???) The logo will be 'Dark IP' in all caps and then 'Gateway' with lowercase. i know it is a crazy name but i didnt elect to change it, i feel i am in a star wars movie.

If you like Bank Gothic, try this ( [http://www.typeoff.de/?p=135](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041510/http:/www.typeoff.de/?p=135 "http://www.typeoff.de/?p=135")); it is Bank Gothic with lowercase letters, too.
ahhh this is perfect thanks a million

You are welcome! Feel free to contact me if you have any more questions. Is this "Gateway" in any way related to RCAS Gateway? I know some designers who worked on graphics for that software package for the military… must have been a little over a decade ago.
No this is a new project, but that would be interesting to see the design from a decade ago for a similiar project.
The closest ones we know of can either be an actual uppercase-only font "Bank Gothic" or maybe even Microgramma Bold Extended, who knows that.

I would like to say that you should keep some [Military Challenge Coins](http://web.archive.org/web/20121130041510/http:/www.maxchallengecoins.com/our-specialty-coins/military-challenge-coins.html) in your project because these coins are made especially for the military and you can use them as an award.
